verses.text: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.comment: Direct speech introduction, common in this section.

verses.text: Say to the people of Israel: Any man of the people of Israel, or of the foreigners living in Israel, who gives any of his offspring to Molech shall surely be put to death. The people of the land shall stone him with stones.
verses.comment: Retains 'Molech' (Hebrew: molek) and phrasing of 'give his offspring', signifying child sacrifice.

verses.text: I myself will set my face against that man and will cut him off from among his people, because he has given one of his children to Molech, to make my sanctuary unclean and to profane my holy name.
verses.comment: "Set my face against" is a literal rendering of the Hebrew idiom for determined opposition.

verses.text: But if the people of the land at all close their eyes to that man when he gives one of his children to Molech, and do not put him to death,
verses.comment: Literal: 'at all hide their eyes.'

verses.text: then I will set my face against that man and against his family, and will cut them off from among their people, both him and all who follow him in whoring after Molech.
verses.comment: Phrase 'whoring after Molech' maintains metaphor for idolatry.

verses.text: If a person turns to mediums or to necromancers, whoring after them, I will set my face against that person and will cut him off from among his people.
verses.comment: Terminology from Hebrew for 'mediums' (ovoth) and 'necromancers' (yiddeonim).

verses.text: Consecrate yourselves, therefore, and be holy, for I am the Lord your God.
verses.comment: Retains imperative, 'be holy.'

verses.text: Keep my statutes and do them. I am the Lord who sanctifies you.
verses.comment: "Sanctifies" literally, 'makes you holy.'

verses.text: For anyone who curses his father or his mother shall surely be put to death. He has cursed his father or his mother; his blood is upon him.
verses.comment: "His blood is upon him" is a Hebrew idiom meaning he is responsible for his own death.

verses.text: If a man commits adultery with the wife of another man, that is, with the wife of his neighbor, both the adulterer and the adulteress shall surely be put to death.
verses.comment: Preserves clear indication of both parties being guilty.

verses.text: If a man lies with his father’s wife, he has uncovered his father’s nakedness. Both of them shall surely be put to death; their blood is upon them.
verses.comment: "Uncovered his father’s nakedness" is a Hebrew idiom explained in Lev. 18:8.

verses.text: If a man lies with his daughter-in-law, both of them shall surely be put to death; they have committed perversion; their blood is upon them.
verses.comment: "Perversion" renders literal Hebrew.

verses.text: If a man lies with a male as with a woman, both of them have committed an abomination; they shall surely be put to death; their blood is upon them.
verses.comment: "Abomination" employs the standard rendering of Hebrew 'toevah'.

verses.text: If a man takes a woman and her mother, it is depravity; they shall be burned with fire, both he and they, that there may be no depravity among you.
verses.comment: "Depravity" is literal for Hebrew 'zimmah'; burning may refer to after execution.

verses.text: If a man lies with an animal, he shall surely be put to death, and you shall kill the animal.
verses.comment: 'Lies with' retains euphemistic original.

verses.text: If a woman approaches any animal and lies with it, you shall kill the woman and the animal; they shall surely be put to death; their blood is upon them.

If a man takes his sister, his father’s daughter or his mother’s daughter, and sees her nakedness, and she sees his nakedness, it is a disgrace. They shall be cut off in the sight of the children of their people. He has uncovered his sister’s nakedness, and he shall bear his iniquity.
verses.comment: 'Cut off' (kareth) may mean excommunication or death.

verses.text: If a man lies with a woman during her menstrual period and uncovers her nakedness, he has made naked her flow, and she has uncovered the source of her blood; both of them shall be cut off from among their people.
verses.comment: Literal rendering of Hebrew idioms.

verses.text: You shall not uncover the nakedness of your mother’s sister or of your father’s sister, for that is to make naked one’s close relative; they shall bear their iniquity.
If a man lies with his uncle’s wife, he has uncovered his uncle’s nakedness; they shall bear their sin; they shall die childless.
verses.comment: 'Die childless' can mean no descendants or literal lack of children.

verses.text: If a man takes his brother’s wife, it is impurity. He has uncovered his brother’s nakedness; they shall be childless.
You shall therefore keep all my statutes and all my rules and do them, so that the land where I am bringing you to live may not vomit you out.
verses.comment: 'Vomit you out' is a literal and vivid Hebrew metaphor.

verses.text: And you shall not walk in the statutes of the nation that I am driving out before you, for they did all these things, and therefore I abhorred them.
verses.comment: 'Abhorred' (Hebrew: qatz) keeps literal sense.

verses.text: But I have said to you, ‘You shall inherit their land, and I will give it to you to possess, a land flowing with milk and honey.’ I am the Lord your God, who has set you apart from the peoples.
verses.comment: 'Set you apart' is literal, not a paraphrase.

verses.text: You shall therefore distinguish between the clean animal and the unclean, and between the unclean bird and the clean. You shall not make yourselves detestable by animal or by bird or by anything with which the ground teems, which I have set apart for you to hold unclean.
You shall be holy to me, for I the Lord am holy and have separated you from the peoples, that you should be mine.
verses.comment: Maintains possessive 'be mine.'

verses.text: A man or a woman who is a medium or a necromancer shall surely be put to death. They shall be stoned with stones; their blood is upon them.
verses.comment: Final ban, retains gendered language of the Hebrew.
